00009   #define out_of_memory() do {                    \
00010       fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory.\n");    \
00011       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);                     \

00014   /* Sadly, sass_strdup is not portable. */
00015   char *sass_strdup(const char *str)
00016   {
00017     char *ret = (char*) malloc(strlen(str) + 1);
00018     if (ret == NULL)
00019       out_of_memory();
00020     strcpy(ret, str);
00021     return ret;
00022   }

00024   /* Locale unspecific atof function. */
00025   double sass_atof(const char *str)
00026   {
00027     char separator = *(localeconv()->decimal_point);
00028     if(separator != '.'){
00029       // The current locale specifies another
00030       // separator. convert the separator to the
00031       // one understood by the locale if needed
00032       const char *found = strchr(str, '.');
00033       if(found != NULL){
00034         // substitution is required. perform the substitution on a copy
00035         // of the string. This is slower but it is thread safe.
00036         char *copy = sass_strdup(str);
00037         *(copy + (found - str)) = separator;
00038         double res = atof(copy);
00039         free(copy);
00040         return res;
00041       }
00042     }
00043 
00044     return atof(str);
00045   }

00047   string string_eval_escapes(const string& s)
00048   {
00049 
00050     string out("");
00051     bool esc = false;
00052     for (size_t i = 0, L = s.length(); i < L; ++i) {
00053       if(s[i] == '\\' && esc == false) {
00054         esc = true;
00055 
00056         // escape length
00057         size_t len = 1;
00058 
00059         // parse as many sequence chars as possible
00060         // ToDo: Check if ruby aborts after possible max
00061         while (i + len < L && s[i + len] && isxdigit(s[i + len])) ++ len;
00062 
00063         // hex string?
00064         if (len > 1) {
00065 
00066           // convert the extracted hex string to code point value
00067           // ToDo: Maybe we could do this without creating a substring
00068           uint32_t cp = strtol(s.substr (i + 1, len - 1).c_str(), nullptr, 16);
00069 
00070           if (cp == 0) cp = 0xFFFD;
00071 
00072           // assert invalid code points
00073           if (cp >= 1) {
00074 
00075             // use a very simple approach to convert via utf8 lib
00076             // maybe there is a more elegant way; maybe we shoud
00077             // convert the whole output from string to a stream!?
00078             // allocate memory for utf8 char and convert to utf8
00079             unsigned char u[5] = {0,0,0,0,0}; utf8::append(cp, u);
00080             for(size_t m = 0; u[m] && m < 5; m++) out.push_back(u[m]);
00081 
00082             // skip some more chars?
00083             i += len - 1; esc = false;
00084             if (cp == 10) out += ' ';
00085 
00086           }
00087 
00088         }
00089 
00090       }
00091       else {
00092         out += s[i];
00093         esc = false;
00094       }
00095     }
00096     return out;
00097 
00098   }

00100   // double escape every escape sequences
00101   // escape unescaped quotes and backslashes
00102   string string_escape(const string& str)
00103   {
00104     string out("");
00105     for (auto i : str) {
00106       // escape some characters
00107       if (i == '"') out += '\\';
00108       if (i == '\'') out += '\\';
00109       if (i == '\\') out += '\\';
00110       out += i;
00111     }
00112     return out;
00113   }

00115   // unescape every escape sequence
00116   // only removes unescaped backslashes
00117   string string_unescape(const string& str)
00118   {
00119     string out("");
00120     bool esc = false;
00121     for (auto i : str) {
00122       if (esc || i != '\\') {
00123         esc = false;
00124         out += i;
00125       } else {
00126         esc = true;
00127       }
00128     }
00129     // open escape sequence at end
00130     // maybe it should thow an error
00131     if (esc) { out += '\\'; }
00132     return out;
00133   }

00135   // read css string (handle multiline DELIM)
00136   string read_css_string(const string& str)
00137   {
00138     string out("");
00139     bool esc = false;
00140     for (auto i : str) {
00141       if (i == '\\') {
00142         esc = ! esc;
00143       } else if (esc && i == '\r') {
00144         continue;
00145       } else if (esc && i == '\n') {
00146         out.resize (out.size () - 1);
00147         esc = false;
00148         continue;
00149       } else {
00150         esc = false;
00151       }
00152       out.push_back(i);
00153     }
00154     if (esc) out += '\\';
00155     return out;
00156   }
00157 
00158   // evacuate unescaped quoted
00159   // leave everything else untouched
00160   string evacuate_quotes(const string& str)
00161   {
00162     string out("");
00163     bool esc = false;
00164     for (auto i : str) {
00165       if (!esc) {
00166         // ignore next character
00167         if (i == '\\') esc = true;
00168         // evacuate unescaped quotes
00169         else if (i == '"') out += '\\';
00170         else if (i == '\'') out += '\\';
00171       }
00172       // get escaped char now
00173       else { esc = false; }
00174       // remove nothing
00175       out += i;
00176     }
00177     return out;
00178   }

00180   // double escape all escape sequences
00181   // keep unescaped quotes and backslashes
00182   string evacuate_escapes(const string& str)
00183   {
00184     string out("");
00185     bool esc = false;
00186     for (auto i : str) {
00187       if (i == '\\' && !esc) {
00188         out += '\\';
00189         out += '\\';
00190         esc = true;
00191       } else if (esc && i == '"') {
00192         out += '\\';
00193         out += i;
00194         esc = false;
00195       } else if (esc && i == '\'') {
00196         out += '\\';
00197         out += i;
00198         esc = false;
00199       } else if (esc && i == '\\') {
00200         out += '\\';
00201         out += i;
00202         esc = false;
00203       } else {
00204         esc = false;
00205         out += i;
00206       }
00207     }
00208     // happens when parsing does not correctly skip
00209     // over escaped sequences for ie. interpolations
00210     // one example: foo\#{interpolate}
00211     // if (esc) out += '\\';
00212     return out;
00213   }

00218     string out("");
00219     for (auto i : str) {
00220       if (i == 10) {
00221         out += ' ';
00222       } else {
00223         out += i;
00224       }
00225     }
00226     return out;

00229   string comment_to_string(const string& text)
00230   {
00231     string str = "";
00232     size_t has = 0;
00233     char prev = 0;
00234     bool clean = false;
00235     for (auto i : text) {
00236       if (clean) {
00237         if (i == '\n') { has = 0; }
00238         else if (i == '\r') { has = 0; }
00239         else if (i == '\t') { ++ has; }
00240         else if (i == ' ') { ++ has; }
00241         else if (i == '*') {}
00242         else {
00243           clean = false;
00244           str += ' ';
00245           if (prev == '*' && i == '/') str += "*/";
00246           else str += i;
00247         }
00248       } else if (i == '\n') {
00249         clean = true;
00250       } else if (i == '\r') {
00251         clean = true;
00252       } else {
00253         str += i;
00254       }
00255       prev = i;
00256     }
00257     if (has) return str;
00258     else return text;
00259   }
00260 
00261    string normalize_wspace(const string& str)
00262   {
00263     bool ws = false;
00264     bool esc = false;
00265     string text = "";
00266     for(const char& i : str) {
00267       if (!esc && i == '\\') {
00268         esc = true;
00269         ws = false;
00270         text += i;
00271       } else if (esc) {
00272         esc = false;
00273         ws = false;
00274         text += i;
00275       } else if (
00276         i == ' ' ||
00277         i == '\r' ||
00278         i == '\n' ||
00279         i == '  '
00280       ) {
00281         // only add one space
00282         if (!ws) text += ' ';
00283         ws = true;
00284       } else {
00285         ws = false;
00286         text += i;
00287       }
00288     }
00289     if (esc) text += '\\';
00290     return text;
00291   }
00292 
00293   // find best quote_mark by detecting if the string contains any single
00294   // or double quotes. When a single quote is found, we not we want a double
00295   // quote as quote_mark. Otherwise we check if the string cotains any double
00296   // quotes, which will trigger the use of single quotes as best quote_mark.
00297   char detect_best_quotemark(const char* s, char qm)
00298   {
00299     // ensure valid fallback quote_mark
00300     char quote_mark = qm && qm != '*' ? qm : '"';
00301     while (*s) {
00302       // force double quotes as soon
00303       // as one single quote is found
00304       if (*s == '\'') { return '"'; }
00305       // a single does not force quote_mark
00306       // maybe we see a double quote later
00307       else if (*s == '"') { quote_mark = '\''; }
00308       ++ s;
00309     }
00310     return quote_mark;
00311   }
00312 
00313   string unquote(const string& s, char* qd)
00314   {
00315 
00316     // not enough room for quotes
00317     // no possibility to unquote
00318     if (s.length() < 2) return s;
00319 
00320     char q;
00321     bool skipped = false;
00322 
00323     // this is no guarantee that the unquoting will work
00324     // what about whitespace before/after the quote_mark?
00325     if      (*s.begin() == '"'  && *s.rbegin() == '"')  q = '"';
00326     else if (*s.begin() == '\'' && *s.rbegin() == '\'') q = '\'';
00327     else                                                return s;
00328 
00329     string unq;
00330     unq.reserve(s.length()-2);
00331 
00332     for (size_t i = 1, L = s.length() - 1; i < L; ++i) {
00333 
00334       // implement the same strange ruby sass behavior
00335       // an escape sequence can also mean a unicode char
00336       if (s[i] == '\\' && !skipped) {
00337         // remember
00338         skipped = true;
00339 
00340         // skip it
00341         // ++ i;
00342 
00343         // if (i == L) break;
00344 
00345         // escape length
00346         size_t len = 1;
00347 
00348         // parse as many sequence chars as possible
00349         // ToDo: Check if ruby aborts after possible max
00350         while (i + len < L && s[i + len] && isxdigit(s[i + len])) ++ len;
00351 
00352         // hex string?
00353         if (len > 1) {
00354 
00355           // convert the extracted hex string to code point value
00356           // ToDo: Maybe we could do this without creating a substring
00357           uint32_t cp = strtol(s.substr (i + 1, len - 1).c_str(), nullptr, 16);
00358 
00359           // assert invalid code points
00360           if (cp == 0) cp = 0xFFFD;
00361           // replace bell character
00362           // if (cp == 10) cp = 32;
00363 
00364           // use a very simple approach to convert via utf8 lib
00365           // maybe there is a more elegant way; maybe we shoud
00366           // convert the whole output from string to a stream!?
00367           // allocate memory for utf8 char and convert to utf8
00368           unsigned char u[5] = {0,0,0,0,0}; utf8::append(cp, u);
00369           for(size_t m = 0; u[m] && m < 5; m++) unq.push_back(u[m]);
00370 
00371           // skip some more chars?
00372           i += len - 1; skipped = false;
00373 
00374         }
00375 
00376 
00377       }
00378       // check for unexpected delimiter
00379       // be strict and throw error back
00380       // else if (!skipped && q == s[i]) {
00381       //   // don't be that strict
00382       //   return s;
00383       //   // this basically always means an internal error and not users fault
00384       //   error("Unescaped delimiter in string to unquote found. [" + s + "]", ParserState("[UNQUOTE]"));
00385       // }
00386       else {
00387         skipped = false;
00388         unq.push_back(s[i]);
00389       }
00390 
00391     }
00392     if (skipped) { return s; }
00393     if (qd) *qd = q;
00394     return unq;
00395 
00396   }
00397 
00398   string quote(const string& s, char q, bool keep_linefeed_whitespace)
00399   {
00400 
00401     // autodetect with fallback to given quote
00402     q = detect_best_quotemark(s.c_str(), q);
00403 
00404     // return an empty quoted string
00405     if (s.empty()) return string(2, q ? q : '"');
00406 
00407     string quoted;
00408     quoted.reserve(s.length()+2);
00409     quoted.push_back(q);
00410 
00411     const char* it = s.c_str();
00412     const char* end = it + strlen(it) + 1;
00413     while (*it && it < end) {
00414       const char* now = it;
00415 
00416       if (*it == q) {
00417         quoted.push_back('\\');
00418       } else if (*it == '\\') {
00419         quoted.push_back('\\');
00420       }
00421 
00422       int cp = utf8::next(it, end);
00423 
00424       if (cp == 10) {
00425         quoted.push_back('\\');
00426         quoted.push_back('a');
00427         // we hope we can remove this flag once we figure out
00428         // why ruby sass has these different output behaviors
00429         if (keep_linefeed_whitespace)
00430           quoted.push_back(' ');
00431       } else if (cp < 127) {
00432         quoted.push_back((char) cp);
00433       } else {
00434         while (now < it) {
00435           quoted.push_back(*now);
00436           ++ now;
00437         }
00438       }
00439     }
00440 
00441     quoted.push_back(q);
00442     return quoted;
00443   }

00445   bool is_hex_doublet(double n)
00446   {
00447     return n == 0x00 || n == 0x11 || n == 0x22 || n == 0x33 ||
00448            n == 0x44 || n == 0x55 || n == 0x66 || n == 0x77 ||
00449            n == 0x88 || n == 0x99 || n == 0xAA || n == 0xBB ||
00450            n == 0xCC || n == 0xDD || n == 0xEE || n == 0xFF ;
00451   }
00452 
00453   bool is_color_doublet(double r, double g, double b)
00454   {
00455     return is_hex_doublet(r) && is_hex_doublet(g) && is_hex_doublet(b);
00456   }

00458   bool peek_linefeed(const char* start)
00459   {
00460     while (*start) {
00461       if (*start == '\n' || *start == '\r') return true;
00462       if (*start != ' ' && *start != '\t') return false;
00463       ++ start;
00464     }
00465     return false;
00466   }

00471     string normalize_underscores(const string& str) {
00472       string normalized = str;
00473       for(size_t i = 0, L = normalized.length(); i < L; ++i) {
00474         if(normalized[i] == '_') {
00475           normalized[i] = '-';
00476         }
00477       }
00478       return normalized;
00479     }

00481     string normalize_decimals(const string& str) {
00482       string prefix = "0";
00483       string normalized = str;
00484 
00485       return normalized[0] == '.' ? normalized.insert(0, prefix) : normalized;

00488     // compress a color sixtuplet if possible
00489     // input: "#CC9900" -> output: "#C90"
00490     string normalize_sixtuplet(const string& col) {
00491       if(
00492         col.substr(1, 1) == col.substr(2, 1) &&
00493         col.substr(3, 1) == col.substr(4, 1) &&
00494         col.substr(5, 1) == col.substr(6, 1)
00495       ) {
00496         return string("#" + col.substr(1, 1)
00497                           + col.substr(3, 1)
00498                           + col.substr(5, 1));
00499       } else {
00500         return string(col);
00501       }
00502     }

00504     bool isPrintable(Ruleset* r, Output_Style style) {
00505       if (r == NULL) {
00506         return false;
00507       }
00508 
00509       Block* b = r->block();
00510 
00511       bool hasSelectors = static_cast<Selector_List*>(r->selector())->length() > 0;
00512 
00513       if (!hasSelectors) {
00514         return false;
00515       }
00516 
00517       bool hasDeclarations = false;
00518       bool hasPrintableChildBlocks = false;
00519       for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00520         Statement* stm = (*b)[i];
00521         if (dynamic_cast<Has_Block*>(stm)) {
00522           Block* pChildBlock = ((Has_Block*)stm)->block();
00523           if (isPrintable(pChildBlock, style)) {
00524             hasPrintableChildBlocks = true;
00525           }
00526         } else if (Comment* c = dynamic_cast<Comment*>(stm)) {
00527           if (style == COMPRESSED) {
00528             hasDeclarations = c->is_important();
00529           } else {
00530             hasDeclarations = true;
00531           }
00532         } else if (Declaration* d = dynamic_cast<Declaration*>(stm)) {
00533           return isPrintable(d, style);
00534         } else {
00535           hasDeclarations = true;
00536         }
00537 
00538         if (hasDeclarations || hasPrintableChildBlocks) {
00539           return true;
00540         }
00541       }
00542 
00543       return false;
00544     }

00547     {
00548       return ! s->value().empty();
00549     }

00552     {
00553       return true;

00556     bool isPrintable(Declaration* d, Output_Style style)
00557     {
00558       Expression* val = d->value();
00559       if (String_Quoted* sq = dynamic_cast<String_Quoted*>(val)) return isPrintable(sq, style);
00560       if (String_Constant* sc = dynamic_cast<String_Constant*>(val)) return isPrintable(sc, style);
00561       return true;
00562     }

00568     bool isPrintable(Feature_Block* f, Output_Style style) {
00569       if (f == NULL) {
00570         return false;
00571       }
00572 
00573       Block* b = f->block();
00574 
00575       bool hasSelectors = f->selector() && static_cast<Selector_List*>(f->selector())->length() > 0;
00576 
00577       bool hasDeclarations = false;
00578       bool hasPrintableChildBlocks = false;
00579       for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00580         Statement* stm = (*b)[i];
00581         if (!stm->is_hoistable() && f->selector() != NULL && !hasSelectors) {
00582           // If a statement isn't hoistable, the selectors apply to it. If there are no selectors (a selector list of length 0),
00583           // then those statements aren't considered printable. That means there was a placeholder that was removed. If the selector
00584           // is NULL, then that means there was never a wrapping selector and it is printable (think of a top level media block with
00585           // a declaration in it).
00586         }
00587         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Declaration) || typeid(*stm) == typeid(At_Rule)) {
00588           hasDeclarations = true;
00589         }
00590         else if (dynamic_cast<Has_Block*>(stm)) {
00591           Block* pChildBlock = ((Has_Block*)stm)->block();
00592           if (isPrintable(pChildBlock, style)) {
00593             hasPrintableChildBlocks = true;
00594           }
00595         }
00596 
00597         if (hasDeclarations || hasPrintableChildBlocks) {
00598           return true;
00599         }
00600       }
00601 
00602       return false;
00603     }
00604 
00605     bool isPrintable(Media_Block* m, Output_Style style) {
00606       if (m == NULL) {
00607         return false;
00608       }
00609 
00610       Block* b = m->block();
00611 
00612       bool hasSelectors = m->selector() && static_cast<Selector_List*>(m->selector())->length() > 0;
00613 
00614       bool hasDeclarations = false;
00615       bool hasPrintableChildBlocks = false;
00616       for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00617         Statement* stm = (*b)[i];
00618         if (!stm->is_hoistable() && m->selector() != NULL && !hasSelectors) {
00619           // If a statement isn't hoistable, the selectors apply to it. If there are no selectors (a selector list of length 0),
00620           // then those statements aren't considered printable. That means there was a placeholder that was removed. If the selector
00621           // is NULL, then that means there was never a wrapping selector and it is printable (think of a top level media block with
00622           // a declaration in it).
00623         }
00624         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Declaration) || typeid(*stm) == typeid(At_Rule)) {
00625           hasDeclarations = true;
00626         }
00627         else if (dynamic_cast<Has_Block*>(stm)) {
00628           Block* pChildBlock = ((Has_Block*)stm)->block();
00629           if (isPrintable(pChildBlock, style)) {
00630             hasPrintableChildBlocks = true;
00631           }
00632         }
00633 
00634         if (hasDeclarations || hasPrintableChildBlocks) {
00635           return true;
00636         }
00637       }
00638 
00639       return false;
00640     }
00641 
00642     bool isPrintable(Block* b, Output_Style style) {
00643       if (b == NULL) {
00644         return false;
00645       }
00646 
00647       for (size_t i = 0, L = b->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00648         Statement* stm = (*b)[i];
00649         if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Declaration) || typeid(*stm) == typeid(At_Rule)) {
00650           return true;
00651         }
00652         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Comment)) {
00653 
00654         }
00655         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Ruleset)) {
00656           Ruleset* r = (Ruleset*) stm;
00657           if (isPrintable(r, style)) {
00658             return true;
00659           }
00660         }
00661         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Feature_Block)) {
00662           Feature_Block* f = (Feature_Block*) stm;
00663           if (isPrintable(f, style)) {
00664             return true;
00665           }
00666         }
00667         else if (typeid(*stm) == typeid(Media_Block)) {
00668           Media_Block* m = (Media_Block*) stm;
00669           if (isPrintable(m, style)) {
00670             return true;
00671           }
00672         }
00673         else if (dynamic_cast<Has_Block*>(stm) && isPrintable(((Has_Block*)stm)->block(), style)) {
00674           return true;
00675         }
00676       }
00677 
00678       return false;
00679     }

00681     string vecJoin(const vector<string>& vec, const string& sep)
00682     {
00683       switch (vec.size())
00684       {
00685         case 0:
00686             return string("");
00687         case 1:
00688             return vec[0];
00689         default:
00690             std::ostringstream os;
00691             os << vec[0];
00692             for (size_t i = 1; i < vec.size(); i++) {
00693               os << sep << vec[i];
00694             }
00695             return os.str();
00696       }
00697     }
00698 
00699      bool isAscii(const char chr) {
00700        return unsigned(chr) < 128;
00701      }
00702 
00703   }
00704 }
